verse.roman:
niśamya vipriyaṁ kṛṣṇo
mānusīṁ prakṛtiṁ gataḥ
vimanasko ghṛṇī snehād
babhāṣe prākṛto yathā

synonyms: niśamya—hearing; vipriyam—disturbing words; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; mānuṣīm—humanlike; prakṛtim—a nature; gataḥ—having assumed; vimanaskaḥ—unhappy; ghṛṇī—compassionate; snehāt—out of love; babhāṣe—He spoke; prākṛtaḥ—an ordinary person; yathā—like.
translation: When He heard this disturbing news, Lord Kṛṣṇa, who was playing the role of a mortal man, showed sorrow and compassion, and out of love for His parents He spoke the following words like an ordinary conditioned soul.
